metadata.notes: 81st Bombardment Squadron was first squadron of 12th BG to enter combat with attack on Mersa Matruh harbor on 17 August 1942. Squadron deployed via South Atlantic route July-August 1942, arriving Egypt mid-August. Initially based at RAF Deversoir (headquarters squadron location) alongside 82nd Squadron, while 434th and 83rd operated from RAF Ismailia 15 miles away. By September 1942, squadron integrated with RAF Desert Air Force. Earned Distinguished Unit Citation for North Africa/Sicily operations October 1942-August 1943. Aircraft variants confirmed as B-25C-NA (Inglewood production) and B-25D-NC (Kansas City production) based on mid-1942 deployment timeline and production schedules. Commander name not located in available sources for Q4 1942. Personnel numbers based on standard USAAF medium bombardment squadron TO&E.

source_validation.corroboration_notes: First combat mission 17 August 1942 at Matruh confirmed by Tier 1 source (American Air Museum). Aircraft variants (B-25C-NA, B-25D-NC) verified through Tier 1 source (B-25 History Project production timeline). Squadron organization and basing confirmed through Tier 1 (Army Air Corps Museum) and Tier 2 (12th BG Honor Roll Project). Battle participation and DUC award confirmed across multiple Tier 1/2 sources. Personnel numbers derived from standard USAAF TO&E referenced in Tier 1 organizational documents. 81st Squadron was first of the group to see combat, preceding 434th Squadron by two weeks.
